intro: Perityle rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf perityle, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are round or heart-shaped, and it produces small white or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. Perityle rotundifolia is often found in association with other moisture-loving plants in its native habitat.
